identified-content.person: DALY, SAGE CLARKSON HURRY (SAGE CLARKSON HURRY WIRTH)

block.p: Sage Clarkson Hurry Daly, a daughter of Ann Fuller of Big Horn, Wyo., and Dr. John S. F. Daly of Chesterfield, N.H., was married yesterday to Christopher Winslow Wirth, the son of former Senator Timothy E. Wirth and Mrs. Wirth of Boulder, Colo., and Washington. The Rev. Roger Daly, a United Church of Christ minister and the bride's uncle, performed the ceremony at the Union Congregational Church in Crested Butte, Colo. His wife, the Rev. Sandra Daly, also a minister of the United Church of Christ, took part in the service.

Mrs. Wirth, 31, graduated from Guilford College in Greensboro, N.C. She operates Three Graces Design, a greeting card company in Boulder. The bride's father, a urologist, is an owner of Grace Urological in Brattleboro, Vt.

Mrs. Wirth, 31, graduated from Guilford College in Greensboro, N.C. She operates Three Graces Design, a greeting card company in Boulder. The bride's father, a urologist, is an owner of Grace Urological in Brattleboro, Vt.

Mr. Wirth, 32, graduated from Stanford and received law and M.B.A. degrees from the University of Colorado. He is a fund manager and financial analyst with the Chotin Group, a venture capital and financial management firm in Denver.

His father, a Democrat, represented Colorado in Congress from 1983 to 1993. He was the under secretary of state for global affairs from 1993 to 1997, and is now the president of the United Nations Foundation, a global philanthropy started by Ted Turner and based in Washington. The bridegroom's mother, Wren Wirth, is president of the Winslow Foundation, a family foundation in Washington, which donates money to environmental and population organizations.
